sect1.title: This is a list of conventions that I follow when writing the HOWTO.

listitem.para: Single space after a period.
xrefs have linkend and endterm attributes.
biliographicentries have their title's id attribute filled in so that xrefs can refer to the title with the endterm attribute.
All sect1 elements have the id attribute filled in with the filename of the HTML verion of the HOWTO.
Whenever suggesting that the reader try a command, tag it with command, parameter tags, as appropriate.
Otherwise, tag the applications with the application tags.
Commands should be formatted to match their man/info pages.
When talking about my personal experience, use a sidebar element.
Tag directories and files with the filename element.
Tag keystrokes appropriately. (keycap, keycombo, keysym, shortcut, accel)
Use a "$" as the user's shell prompt and "#" as the root shell prompt. Or use a custom prompt if its a prompt within an application program. Tag them with prompt.
All commands or series of commands get their own paragraph.
URLs to documents go at the end of the article.
Biblios will have two URLs to the document, one internet (http:, ftp:) and one locate (file:).
Standard licensing text will be put into an appendix.
Appendix information for the various, standard licences (GPL, LGPL, Artistic, BSD, etc.).
Use Gbyte, Mbyte, Kbyte, byte.
dependant, not dependent
put a warning whereever a file is getting erased or overwritten.
make a note to merge/remove the .rpmsave files.
GNU wants the sections catorgorized as 'invarient', backmatter, frontmatter, etc
